title: Write Your First Test
description: Learn to write a simple test using Node.js built-in test runner. Testing is essential for reliable code.

initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Write Your First Test

Write tests for a simple math utility module.

## Objectives
1. Create a test file for mathUtils.js
2. Write tests for the add and multiply functions
3. Run the tests and make sure they pass

objectives.description: Write a test for add function

bonusObjectives.description: Test the divide function including error case

hints.text: Node.js has a built-in test runner. Use require('node:test') to import it.
Try: 'Write tests for mathUtils.js using Node's built-in test runner'
Ask: 'Create mathUtils.test.js with tests for add, multiply, and divide functions using node:test and node:assert'

solution.approach: Create a test file that imports node:test and node:assert, then write test cases.
solution.example: Write tests for the math utility functions in mathUtils.js
alternativeApproaches: Add test coverage for the math functions

learningPoints: Node.js has a built-in test runner (node:test)
Tests use assertions to verify expected behavior
